text: hi everyone is Helen here today I will
make a traditional Vietnamese rice cake
it's called Banzai together with monk
young and the ice is served during
Vietnamese Lunar New Year our pet as a
symbol for the harmony between the earth
and the heaven in the other days as you
know is his belief that the earth is
square and the heaven is Rao so while
there are square and green bunching
symbolizes the earth the white and curvy
bunny eyes then fraud up high heaven
most people especially those in the
northern of Vietnam they offer a bowl of
these cakes to the ancestor for the new
year so let's begin today I will make my
laser which is like a sandwich made of
two steamed rice cakes and a piece of
steamed pork sausage in the center the
ingredients you're going to need 200
gram of glutinous rice flour 10 gram of
plain rice flour about 190 ml of water
or milk half a teaspoon of salt and some
Pororo and banana leaf very simple right
first of all come by the glutinous rice
flour and rice flour in a mixing bowl
and then mix it well in the center you
want to hit the water or the milk to 80
degrees cesses and then pour into the
hole traditionally this cake is made
with playing hot water but I wanted to
have a more tasty flavor so I use milk
instead then I'll wait for a couple of
seconds so it's cooled out enough to
handle knead with your hands until the
dough is formed then you want to wrap it
in a piece of saran wrap and let sit for
about 15 minutes
next grease your hands with some
vegetable oil and you can divide the
dough into 8 equal pieces or just pinch
a piece of dough about 48 gram and shape
in two or more and then you under flood
on it out into the thickness of
about one centimeter or one eighth of an
inch and then place on a piece of
parchment paper and repeat until you
finish off the job and we're gonna place
it into the steamer and steam for eight
minutes from the points that the water
boiling cut banana leaf into eight equal
rails the reason I you patterned paper
to steam instead of banana leaf because
I want to keep the color of the banana
leaf
so after steaming you take out and place
the rice cake on the banana leaf so the
leaf has still this green and beautiful
color so just simply sandwich a piece of
this jello into between two pieces of
rice cake and it becomes a Vietnamese
hamburger or sandwich it's presently
tasty and it's bring back a lot of great
memories eating this you can keep the
rice cake in the fridge for about a week
just reheat them in the microwave for
about forty-five seconds and they could
eat again it's really simple but yes
really tasty and addicting too you also
can dip it in some light dipping fish
sauce if you like the soft and sticky
glutinous rice cake celebrate the
simplicity and importance of rice in
Vietnamese culture and this is a really
great trick for both the king and the
commoners I hope you enjoyed today's
video and if you like the idea don't
